abstract: While a dip in prices is potentially good news for the developing world, a grain expert says that tough economic times really only guarantee uncertainty for food security.
snippet: While a dip in prices is potentially good news for the developing world, a grain expert says that tough economic times really only guarantee uncertainty for food security.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

lead_paragraph: For some Americans, fall is traditionally a season of celebrating the harvest and anticipating a groaning Thanksgiving table. Globally, it's also the time of year for some important reports on cereal markets and food security.

headline.main: Report Sees Tight Global Cereal Markets
